description: Sheldon Silver, the former powerful speaker of the New York State Assembly, was found guilty on all counts in his corruption trial. The government said he used “the power and influence of his official position to obtain for himself millions of dollars of bribes and kickbacks.”
title: The Case Against Sheldon Silver
title_page: The Case Against Sheldon Silver - The New York Times
maintext:
$700,000 in Bribes and Kickbacks From a Real Estate Law Firm
Mr. Silver persuaded developers who had business with the state to use a real estate law firm run by a former aide.
The U.S. attorney agreed not to prosecute a lobbyist who provided information.
for the referrals
Jay Arthur Goldberg, one of the partners, was a former counsel to Mr. Silver.
A lawyer at this firm was granted immunity.
